Package fr.sorbonne_u.components.cyphy.plugins.devs.architectures

DEVS simulation architecture descriptions for a cyber-physical component model based on BCM.

See: Description

  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    ComponentCoupledModelDescriptorI
    The class ComponentCoupledModelDescriptorI declares the methods that a component coupled model descriptor must provide.
    ComponentModelArchitectureI
    The interface ComponentBaseModelArchitectureI declares the methods that are specific to component-based simulation architectures.
    ComponentModelDescriptorI
    The interface ComponentModelDescriptorI declares the methods that are common to the component atomic and coupled model descriptors.
  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    ComponentAtomicModelDescriptor
    The class ComponentAtomicModelDescriptor implements a descriptor of a DEVS atomic model that is held by a BCM component in a BCM component assembly; using the DEVS closure over composition property, the model actually created by the BCM component can be a coupled model but it will be described as an atomic one in the global architecture for the interconnection.
    ComponentCoupledModelDescriptor
    The class ComponentCoupledModelDescriptor implements a descriptor of a DEVS coupled models that is held by a BCM component in a BCM component assembly, associating their URI, their static information including the mapping to the holding component in the assembly, as well as an optional factory that can be used to instantiate a coupled model object to run simulations.
    ComponentModelArchitecture
    The class ComponentModelArchitecture extends DEVS simulation architectures to include information about the mapping of simulation models to BCM components and provides methods used by the supervisor component to create the system-wide simulator from this architecture onto the component assembly.
    ComponentModelArchitectureHelper
    The class ComponentArchitectureHelper defines code that is used by component simulation architectures to create and interconnect simulation models held by BCM components.
    ComponentModelComposer
    The class ComponentModelComposer implements methods used when composing simulation models deployed on BCM components.
    ComponentParentReference
    The class ComponentParentReference defines a reference to a parent (coupled) model that will require a component connection to be put in place.
    PortURISinkReference
    The class PortURISinkReference defines a reference to a sink model that must receive external events that will require a component connection to be put in place.
    RTComponentAtomicModelDescriptor
    The class RTComponentAtomicModelDescriptor implements a descriptor of a DEVS real time atomic model that is held by a BCM component in a BCM component assembly.
    RTComponentCoupledModelDescriptor
    The class RTComponentCoupledModelDescriptor implements a descriptor of a DEVS coupled models that is held by a BCM component.
    RTComponentModelArchitecture
    The class RTComponentModelArchitecture implements real time component model simulation architectures.

Package fr.sorbonne_u.components.cyphy.plugins.devs.architectures Description

DEVS simulation architecture descriptions for a cyber-physical component model based on BCM.

Licence

Copyright Jacques Malenfant, Sorbonne Universite.

Jacques.Malenfant@lip6.fr

This software is a computer program whose purpose is to provide an extension of the BCM component model that aims to define a components tailored for cyber-physical control systems (CPCS) for Java.

This software is governed by the CeCILL-C license under French law and abiding by the rules of distribution of free software. You can use, modify and/ or redistribute the software under the terms of the CeCILL-C license as circulated by CEA, CNRS and INRIA at the following URL http://www.cecill.info.

As a counterpart to the access to the source code and rights to copy, modify and redistribute granted by the license, users are provided only with a limited warranty and the software's author, the holder of the economic rights, and the successive licensors have only limited liability.

In this respect, the user's attention is drawn to the risks associated with loading, using, modifying and/or developing or reproducing the software by the user in light of its specific status of free software, that may mean that it is complicated to manipulate, and that also therefore means that it is reserved for developers and experienced professionals having in-depth computer knowledge. Users are therefore encouraged to load and test the software's suitability as regards their requirements in conditions enabling the security of their systems and/or data to be ensured and, more generally, to use and operate it in the same conditions as regards security.

The fact that you are presently reading this means that you have had knowledge of the CeCILL-C license and that you accept its terms.

This package is a part of a library that integrates DEVS simulation models in Java with the BCM component model also written in Java. DEVS allows to define modular simulation models that are composed through coupled models by interconnecting them in order to exchange events. Coupled models also play a coordination role when executing simulation runs by repeatedly selecting their next submodel having a transition to be executed and giving them the control to perform the transition.

When integrating DEVS with BCM, modular simulation models will be distributed among components. Hence, a simulation architecture needs to provide a mapping from simulation models to components. This package extends classes defined in the DEVS library for simulation architecture to add the necessary mapping between models and components in order to allow the interconnections between models to follow BCM component interconnections using component interfaces, ports and connectors (rather than plain Java references).
